text: My live COVID-19 Q&A is starting soon—tune in on my Facebook page here: https://t.co/5Q4LaJeS9q

No Montanan should have to choose between paying medical bills and putting food on the table for their families during a public health crisis. I fought to expand SNAP benefits to ensure no one in our state goes hungry as we combat this crisis. https://t.co/0DbYMHJcr9

This is an uncertain time for folks across our state, and I know Montanans have lots of questions. I’m holding another COVID-19 Facebook Live this afternoon to answer questions and address concerns. Submit your thoughts below. I'll see you this afternoon. https://t.co/dNXH90Br8O
I’m grateful every day to call the Treasure State home and to serve the folks that make Montana the Last Best Place. Happy #406day! https://t.co/Jkx3VIs81j

I know folks have a lot of questions during this uncertain time—and I'm here to help. I’m holding another Facebook Live Q&A TOMORROW, April 6th at 4pm MT. Submit your questions here: https://t.co/dNXH90Br8O

The #CARESAct spends trillions of taxpayer dollars—we've got to ensure that money is being spent responsibly. @SenatorRomney and I are calling on the Administration to ensure the watchdog overseeing pandemic recovery can make regular, independent reports to Congress. https://t.co/JhaFWim2Zj

If you're having trouble navigating a government agency during this crisis or in search of further resources, visit my Coronavirus Resource page below or contact my office at 202-224-2644. Stay safe. We'll get through this. https://t.co/36wsHNEqn0
Thanks to everyone for joining this afternoon's Facebook Live Q&A. Hearing feedback from folks on the ground is critical in combating this outbreak.
In a few moments, I'll be going LIVE on Facebook to take questions and hear feedback from Montanans impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. Join me here:  https://t.co/FV9xXoP4bS
Submit questions here: https://t.co/Hh0nM11Sed

Whether you're a nurse on the front lines or a small business owner making tough calls, the COVID-19 outbreak is impacting Montanans across our state—and I want to hear from you. Join me this afternoon at 12:30pm MT as I take your questions and hear feedback live on Facebook.
In a few minutes, I'll be live on Montana PBS to discuss how we're fighting to keep Montanans secure during COVID-19 outbreak. Tune in here: https://t.co/YuXph6T60W

During these uncertain times, remember that your mental health is just as important as your physical health. Montana is expanding mental health resources and increasing at-home access. Learn more here: https://t.co/rW5dNjIwYL

Montana teachers have always put their students first—and social distancing isn’t stopping them now. These educators are keeping our communities together and students engaged through the power of music. https://t.co/X1oACqMYfh

When the going gets tough, Montanans come together and get going. Proud to see these innovators take their Montana Masks global—providing cutting-edge technological support for the folks that need it. https://t.co/uH92CyLBUC

The COVID-19 pandemic is affecting Montanans in ways big and small, and I want to hear from you. I’ll be taking your questions and hearing your feedback LIVE on Friday, April 3rd at 12:30pm MDT. Submit your questions here: https://t.co/ZFHjxbTitA
It’s never been easier to fill out the Census—you can do so online, by phone, or by mail, and it only takes about ten minutes. #GetCounted today: https://t.co/3bLEaMNBuG
For more information on how the Census serves Montana, visit https://t.co/I874F7CO80. #GetCounted

Montanans have a lot to gain from the 2020 Census. Getting counted means more investments in our schools, hospitals, infrastructure and could even lead to another representative in Congress, bringing more MT common sense to Washington. Fill out your census today! #JustMakesCensus https://t.co/HkEA0pc8tc

MT's colleges and universities are pioneers of education and innovation in our state—we can't leave them behind. Proud to secure this funding to ensure our higher education institutions have the tools they need stay afloat during these uncertain times. https://t.co/znT1oDJl5Y

Now that the #CARESAct is law, I’ll be fighting to hold the Administration accountable and working to ensure relief finds its way quickly into the hands of Montanans who need it. https://t.co/RnZ17iVx5n

It wasn't too long ago that I was visiting the doctors and nurses at @BozemanHealth Now, these brave health care workers—and others across MT—are risking their lives to keep the folks in our communities healthy. Grateful today, and every day, for their sacrifice. #DoctorsDay https://t.co/zNo3zSoqU1

With so many of MT’s public servants braving the front lines of the COVID-19 outbreak, it would be out of line to penalize them for missing a student loan payment as they’re risking their lives to keep folks healthy. My bill—now law—ensures they won’t be. https://t.co/W8papacx4R

I'll keep working with state and local governments, agencies, and folks on the ground to ensure relief is getting swiftly into the hands of the folks that need it, and those combating this virus on the front lines have the resources they need to contain it.
I fought tooth and nail to secure $1.25 billion for Montana's coronavirus relief fund, giving our state as many tools as possible to keep our communities healthy and safe.

The President just signed the #CARESAct into law. This bill isn't perfect, but provides critical aid to Montanans impacted by the COVID-19 crisis. I'll be fighting every step of the way to ensure MT's families, workers, & small businesses can quickly access the relief they need.

As Montana schools turn to online learning to reduce the spread of COVID-19, it’s more important than ever students in rural areas have reliable, high-speed internet. I’m calling on @AjitPaiFCC to ensure all K-12 students have the access they need to continue their education. https://t.co/yPWGAds79Z

Our Native communities are among the most vulnerable to the impacts of COVID-19, but original drafts of the Coronavirus relief package did NOT include funding specifically for tribes. Proud to secure $10 billion in urgent relief for folks in Indian Country in the final bill. https://t.co/EcD6qGWzPF

Small businesses across Montana feeling the impacts of the COVID-19 outbreak may be eligible for financial assistance through the @SBAgov's Disaster Loan Assistance program. Find out if your small business qualifies and apply here: https://t.co/UhydKqBE8J

Many of the teachers, first responders, and nurses who went into public service after graduating are now on the front lines during this public health crisis. These are the very last people who should be penalized for missing a student loan payment. My bill ensures they won't be. https://t.co/JvinkkYiNS
If you or a loved one is abroad and having trouble securing safe travel back home, please don't hesitate to reach out to my office at 202-224-2644 or send us a message at https://t.co/5HKw7dVuLZ.
I'm working closely with the State Department, cruise operators, airlines and other agencies to ensure Montanans abroad can quickly and safely return to the US.

Montana’s health care workers are on the front lines combating the COVID-19 outbreak. They need our help to slow the spread of this virus—for most of us, that means staying at home. https://t.co/RoxQqBexi1
More information on this critical aid package can be found here: https://t.co/ZmBxxNrO7h

While this bill is far from perfect, the #CARESAct provides the urgent relief and critical resources that Montanans need in the face of this outbreak—direct aid to Montana families, hospitals, small businesses, veterans, workers, state, local, and Tribal governments and more.

After 72 hours of bipartisan negotiations, the Senate passed the third Coronavirus relief package, the #CARESAct, delivering vital relief to Montana workers, small businesses, families, and hospitals.

I'm glad @DeptofDefense is beginning to support National Guard members that are risking their lives to protect folks during this pandemic, but we've got to ensure EVERY activated Guard member—especially those in MT—receives the benefits they earned. https://t.co/uSqUfceTIh

Montana's doctors and nurses cannot wait on government bureaucracy for another moment. Folks are sewing their own masks or going without—putting their own health at risk. @HHSGov & @fema have the equipment—they need to release it now.

Where are the masks? While supplies dwindle to dangerous shortages, the Administration has failed to coordinate the release of critical, life-saving protective equipment for Montana's health care workers combating this crisis on the front lines. https://t.co/jtSnUK5fFA

From Hardin to Libby, health centers in MT are on the front lines in combating the COVID-19 outbreak. I fought to secure more than $800,000 in critical funding to support health centers in 14 MT counties for testing, medical supplies, telehealth & more. https://t.co/bAVdhTlK78

There hasn't been a more important time to stop and thank our nation's farmers, ranchers, and food suppliers for the hard work they do to keep our shelves stocked and food on our tables. Grateful for producers across Montana and the U.S. today on #NationalAgDay. https://t.co/UU2hK3iMNX

As folks stay at home to reduce the spread of COVID-19, those at risk of domestic violence will face increased stress. It’s essential that @HHSgov and @TheJusticeDept ensure victims & survivors of domestic violence continue to have access to vital services during this tough time. https://t.co/PN07q2wXze
RT @SVACDems: Our veterans—and the family members who provide their care—need access to information on how to stay healthy and what service…

Montanans should be worried about keeping their families healthy, not standing in line at the DMV to fill out government paperwork. The deadline to obtain a REAL ID to fly commercially has been delayed—helping folks remain in compliance with the law while keeping families safe.

Regional airports play a critical role in keeping folks in rural America connected. As the Senate continues to debate boosts for air carriers in the face of this outbreak, we can’t leave our local airports—and their hundreds of workers—behind. https://t.co/OoePeiF0DR
If you or a loved one is abroad and having trouble securing safe travel back home, please don't hesitate to reach out to my office at 202-224-2644 or send us a message at https://t.co/WHUFxaXPdk.

Good news! The Norwegian Jewel cruise ship has safely docked in Hawaii and folks aboard—including 16 Montanans—are now headed home. I'll continue to work with the State Department, cruise operators, airlines and more to ensure Montanans abroad can safely return to the US.

Today marks the 10th anniversary of the Affordable Care Act. It’s now more important than ever that we continue to protect folks with preexisting conditions and build upon this landmark legislation that provides critical access to care for millions of Americans.

Montanans are working together to provide cutting-edge support and filling gaps in urgently-needed medical supplies. There’s no doubt their innovative technology to protect our health care workers will save lives.
https://t.co/zRFCeZTWvz

Montana's small businesses are the lifeblood of our state. I'm glad the @SBAgov extended disaster relief to include all 56 counties in Montana, making new resources available to provide critical relief for small businesses in the face of this outbreak. https://t.co/NsmCBU5Xwe
https://t.co/KJGtgiD9Gk

After stalling, HHS Secretary Azar finally released the critical funding Indian Country needs to combat COVID-19. While I'm relieved the funds were released, to say this delay was unacceptable would be a gross understatement. In a crisis like this, every second matters.

The last thing Montanans need to focus on during a public health crisis is filing forms with the IRS. Glad that Treasury Secretary Mnuchin answered my call to extend the filing deadline for taxpayers and businesses. Montanans will now have until July 15 to file without penalties.
As always, please reach out to my office at (202) 224-2644 or send us a message at https://t.co/WHUFxaXPdk. Our door is always open.

Thanks to everyone for joining yesterday’s Facebook Live. Your input is critical as we’re working to secure vital resources for Montanans impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. As promised, a list of resources available for folks in need can be found here: https://t.co/PKitloURgU
In a few moments, I'll be going LIVE on Facebook to answer your questions, address your concerns, and hear your feedback on the COVID-19 outbreak. Join me HERE: https://t.co/5Q4LaJeS9q

The cattle markets in Montana haven't been immune to the impacts of COVID-19—beef prices have seen their steepest decline in forty years. I'm urging @SecretarySonny to take immediate action to stabilize beef markets and support Montana's cattle industry before its too late. https://t.co/O68ydqeBZZ

This afternoon at 2pm MT, I'll be chatting to you via Facebook Live from my office here in Washington to answer your questions and address your concerns regarding the COVID-19 outbreak and its impacts on Montana. Submit your questions HERE: https://t.co/LGCobo3fKz

Telehealth is one of the best tools we have to keep doctors and nurses safe, reduce pressure on hospitals, and help #stopthespread. I’m pushing @AjitPaiFCC to invest in rural broadband and increase access to telehealth during the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/Tv4Yty0I6R

Wondering how you can help out during this crisis? Montana is facing critical shortages of blood donations due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Please consider donating—find your local Red Cross here:
https://t.co/o4o73FEvRB

I want to hear from you as we work to combat COVID-19 in Montana, so I can be your voice in Washington, DC. I’ll be taking your questions LIVE tomorrow, March 19th at 2pm MT. Submit your questions and ideas below: https://t.co/LGCobnLET1

The Senate just passed a critical Coronavirus relief package, delivering support for Montana workers, veterans, Tribes, and families in the face of the COVID-19 outbreak. This is a critical first step—but we have a lot more work to do. I'll keep fighting to keep Montanans secure. https://t.co/k5g6lBukqk

In times of crisis, we’ve all got to do our part to protect the most vulnerable in our communities. Be sure to check for changes in grocery store hours to avoid putting vulnerable Montanans at risk.  https://t.co/tcOwsdGkWe

The closure of schools and businesses across the state have hit Indian Country hard. I’m fighting to ensure Native communities are given timely access to COVID-19 resources and information, including $64 million for testing and medical supplies. https://t.co/1NgmPyMaVY

It’s critical that we get input from Montanans of all stripes to understand how we can curb the impacts of this crisis for them. I’ll continue to speak with folks on the ground in MT as we fight here in Washington to secure vital resources to combat the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/Jo1XmXbabr

Majority Leader McConnell needs to stop playing politics with the health and safety of the American people. Time to vote on a package that supports those impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. We don’t have any more time to waste. https://t.co/J8co85B0HM

I’m headed to the Senate floor to demand Majority Leader McConnell bring the coronavirus relief package up for a vote. Montanans shouldn’t have to wait any longer for resources critical to combating the COVID-19 outbreak. Tune in here: https://t.co/LZ5kPsHeL3
RT @AbbieRBennett: The Senate tonight passed a bill aimed at protecting GI Bill benefits in the event of school closures/transition to onli…

I’m in Washington ready to vote on bipartisan legislation that guarantees free COVID-19 testing for all Montanans and provides support for folks impacted by the outbreak. The clock is ticking—we’re just waiting on @senatemajldr. https://t.co/oSfRO9fdwC

Great news: Montana Air National Guard is a finalist to be considered for new C-130J aircraft, equipment that is critical for our nat’l security. We’re a step closer to securing this new fleet that’ll provide certainty for the Montana men and women who carry out flying missions.
The @DeptVetAffairs acts as a back-up health care system in times of crisis. I’m working to ensure VA has all the resources needed to keep communities everywhere safe. https://t.co/WjJNMSwOv4
Proud of our Montana communities for coming together to help support families, health care workers, and first responders during this crisis. https://t.co/A1tFhT6WKC

The Senate needs to vote on the bipartisan House-passed bill to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Senator McConnell should have let us pass it this weekend and I urge him to do so Monday. I will continue to work with Republicans and Democrats to get this done ASAP.

I led the bipartisan push to replace the aging aircraft at MANG’s 120th Airlift Wing to update our defense capabilities & ensure Montanans’ safety. I saw firsthand today how the Admin’s decision to rob that funding for an ineffective Southern border wall puts that safety at risk. https://t.co/flcO3lqSfu

No Montanan should have to pay for COVID-19 testing—period. I’m backing legislation to waive the costs for getting tested, regardless of whether you’re on Medicare, on private insurance, or not insured at all. https://t.co/ckhW1tq6Ax

Got to join Tim Lee with STAR radio this morning to discuss how we’re addressing COVID-19, increasing access to broadband in rural America, and my plan to update critical equipment at Montana Air National Guard. It was great to be with you. https://t.co/qFUY2mBkND
Grateful to join @KRTV this morning as we discuss the steps we’re taking at the state and federal levels to address the COVID-19 outbreak and keep Montanans safe. https://t.co/EDrbdtnG6B

RT @SenJackyRosen: It’s our responsibility to care for all of our veterans when they return home. 

Honored to help introduce this legislat…
The Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services is monitoring the pandemic closely. For more information, visit their website here: https://t.co/ayHPbf26SF

The coronavirus is serious. I’ve been holding the Administration accountable to make sure that vulnerable Montanans like seniors, folks with disabilities, and health care workers have access to timely information about test kits and proper protection. https://t.co/CTL644LlAz

Thanks to the members of the Montana State Firemen's Association and their families for stopping by today to discuss ways we can better fight for them. Our first responders care for us, and it’s up to us ensure they're cared for in return. https://t.co/CexTQLR4zs

Mr. Fox's 7th grade American History class asked me today to describe my favorite thing about being a Senator, and I told them the truth—that it's visiting with groups of students like them, hearing their input, and fighting to make Montana a better place for their generation. https://t.co/0d3MubseQm
Same. (But with less fingers.) https://t.co/JvV49tigBH https://t.co/Nh6NO5WI9n

When Americans walk into a voting booth, they should have confidence that their vote—an act fundamental to democracy—is free from foreign interference. I'm backing the #SHIELDAct, which strengthens our elections by increasing transparency and keeping foreign meddlers out. https://t.co/l4WxVpQrNi

Montanans deserve a government that works for them, not special interests. #HR1 gets dark money out of politics and works to restore accountability in our government. It's well past time @senatemajldr bring this critical bill to the Senate floor for a vote.

And of course, there's Sharla Tester, my partner on the farm and partner in life. Proud to celebrate the women in agriculture that serve our communities and feed our world today on #InternationalWomensDay and beyond. https://t.co/M8zNp9jFbi

Dr. Heather Estrada, a professor of Ag at @fvccmt in Kalispell, MT, developed the Ag Program and Campus Farm to help students grow their understanding for responsible farming and support their passion within Montana's agricultural industry. #WomenInAg #InternationalWomensDay https://t.co/Oew7wqepQs

Michelle Erickson-Jones, a 4th generation farmer from Broadview, MT, raises wheat, corn, safflower, alfalfa and more. She is active in advocacy and ag policy, serving in 2018 as the first woman president of the MT Grain Growers Association. #WomenInAg #InternationalWomensDay https://t.co/mD2JgP5axL

Maime Hertel of Moore, MT, grew up raking hay, running the combine, salting cows and more. Mamie is the first MT woman to be elected as the @NationalFFA Central Region VP, and this year will travel the region promoting agricultural development. #WomenInAg #InternationalWomensDay https://t.co/P6QgtBMBYK

Celebrating women of all walks of life on #InternationalWomensDay, with a special nod to those in Montana that make our state the Last Best Place. MT women are running businesses, serving their communities, fighting for freedom, molding our next generation of leaders, and more.

Montana's Jessie Royer ran her first dog sled race at 15. Now, she's kicking off her 18th Iditarod Trail start with her elite team. Good luck, Jessie! Montana is rooting for you. https://t.co/rDv6qogofZ

Honored to join the community in celebrating the graduating class of the Great Falls Veterans Treatment Court today. We've got to continue to expand our reach to Native vets, helping these folks get back on their feet with access to housing, job training, and mental health care. https://t.co/3BfyJOC52s

Earlier today, I joined Major General Quinn of the Montana Air National Guard to discuss critical funding to replace the aging C-130H fleet. Securing new C-130Js is essential to bolstering our national defense and protecting the men and women who serve this country. https://t.co/dP0AzJxKHM

There’s no denying William Perry Pendley has been front and center on proposals to sell off our public lands—I told Secretary Bernhardt that Pendley’s got no business being at the top of the Bureau of Land Management. https://t.co/qhw4cpsAMu

When Sec DeVos decided to pull funding from rural schools across MT, I demanded she reverse course. Now @usedgov is pumping the brakes on that reckless decision—but it's not over. I'll keep fighting to ensure MT kids have the resources they need to thrive. https://t.co/QswoND4Sug

The Land and Water Conservation Fund is the best conservation tool we have at the federal level. I'm thrilled the President and Senator McConnell have changed their position and are now backing my bipartisan legislation to fully and permanently fund LWCF. https://t.co/lyOLEql07O

I've been fighting tooth and nail to fully fund the Land and Water Conservation Fund—and it's time to get it done. Tune in as my colleagues and I discuss our bipartisan efforts to fully fund LWCF and preserve our public lands for generations to come. https://t.co/xpHEKmGXVm

Sat down with General Joseph Lengyel @ChiefNGB yesterday, ahead of today’s Appropriations Subcommittee on Defense hearing to discuss President Trump's FY21 budget and the Administration’s recent move to transfer $3.8 billion from troops and the #NationalGuard for his border wall. https://t.co/iMJOAM7JT1

The Montana Department of Health and Human Services is closely monitoring coronavirus. While there are currently no cases of coronavirus reported in Montana, updates and further information can be found here: https://t.co/pj4QxUrpYl

Stagecoach Mary, the first black woman to serve as a mail carrier, delivered post by stagecoach across MT for 8 years. Beloved by the community and feared by thieves, her tough reputation preceded her, and was always known for getting the job done right. #BlackHistoryMonth

James Presley Ball, a daguerreotyper, abolitionist, and businessman, moved to Helena in 1887. He opened a studio and photographed the construction of our State Capitol building. Active in MT politics, Ball was elected to the MT Republican convention in 1894. #BlackHistoryMonth

Alma Smith Jacobs, a librarian and civil rights advocate, cofounded the Montana Advisory Committee for U.S. Civil Rights Commission and Humanities Montana. Alma was the first African American to serve as Montana State Librarian in 1973. #BlackHistoryMonth

James Dorsey, a lawyer and civil rights activist, was the first black student to graduate from both the undergraduate and law programs at @umontana. His legacy lives on with the Dorsey-King Memorial Scholarship, honoring students committed to racial justice. #BlackHistoryMonth

Although #BlackHistoryMonth is coming to an end, we recognize the contributions of America’s African American community year-round. Here’s a look at just a few of the remarkable black men and women of MT who have contributed to our great history and the fight for racial justice:

Celebrating the Senate's passage of #PublicSchoolsWeek by joining the young leaders of Mrs. McBride's and Mrs. Wall's classes at Four Georgians Elementary School in Helena. Thanks for letting me share a couple of stories this afternoon—it was great to be with you. https://t.co/Ef8uZ6ylTq

Over 90% of America's students attend public schools. My resolution to designate Feb 24-28 National Public Schools Week has just passed the Senate, recognizing the important work our schools do every day to empower and prepare students for their next steps. https://t.co/jPl38RLZIC
Thanks! https://t.co/DJldr5LkPt https://t.co/RYj37tJIOC

It doesn't matter if you live in a big city or a small town—Montana's infrastructure is critical to ensuring our communities thrive. Proud to secure funds for the folks living in Seeley Lake and all across our state. https://t.co/qzNrIv7YKp https://t.co/9iSvoiVZuq
RT @SVACDems: Ranking Member @SenatorTester: “What does Blue Water Navy, and Agent Orange presumptive benefits, and caregivers all have in…

As Ranking Member of the Homeland Security Appropriations Subcommittee, its my job to ensure taxpayer dollars are used to secure our nation, not on an ineffective border wall that could split in half private farms and ranches owned by folks living along the border. https://t.co/58vM5V5lWU
RT @SVACDems: HAPPENING NOW: @SenatorTester joins a panel of the Senate and House Veterans’ Affairs Committees to hear and discuss @DAVHQ’s…

Honored to join the National American Indian Housing Council this morning. As we face a country-wide housing crisis, I'm thankful for the great work you do to advocate for accessible housing in Native American communities across the nation. https://t.co/NgXsB3QkuC

Honored to have Montana's Teacher of the Year, Linda Rost of Baker High School, stop in this afternoon. Linda is a finalist to be named National Teacher of the Year. Her commitment to excellence in teaching qualifies her to go all the way—Montana is rooting for you, Linda! https://t.co/u68JFEnb1X
Had a great time traveling across Montana this week and visiting with the folks that make our state the Last Best Place. Cheers to you. https://t.co/dulzBjQ5iA

Happy 100th birthday Dorothy! Dorothy served our nation during WWII and now serves folks in Bozeman as an active member of @hrdcbozeman. Thanks for all you do to make Montana proud.
https://t.co/BKWDYXkbCA

Thanks to all the panelists and guests that came out to participate in today's Housing Summit. Hearing from experts on the ground gives me the tools I need to bring to Washington as we fight to make affordable housing in Montana a reality. 

Now let's get to work.

Finally, we've got a panel of housing providers to tackle the question of availability. We've got to find ways to ensure Montanans in rural and urban areas alike have affordable options available to call home. https://t.co/AVaAVTKQ44

Up next, panel number two. We're talking with federal, state, and local officials about how to improve access to affordable housing, and exploring which policies could be implemented to address this challenge. https://t.co/ulRUkCC3Ia

Our first panel features housing providers, area stakeholders, and advocates. We're putting our heads together to discuss the biggest impediments folks face when it comes to affordable housing in Montana. https://t.co/KN2SjIZ4lc

Every Montanan deserves to live in a safe and affordable home. I'm in Helena today hosting a Housing Summit to discuss the lack of affordable housing in Montana. We'll hear 3 panels of experts to find ways we can work to address this challenge facing too many of our communities.

I got to join the business and community leaders of our capital city this morning at the Hometown Helena meeting. It was great to hear how these folks are moving the Helena community forward. Thanks for having me. https://t.co/S3Y2KZffZC

As commodity prices dip and farmers and ranchers face uncertainty, ensuring they have access to mental health services is more important than ever. Thanks to Kevin Stanfield and @KBZK for having me on to talk #SeedingRuralResilienceAct and how we can better serve MT's producers. https://t.co/pXfcOhQkYn

Got to join folks at Bozeman Health today to discuss their work to address health care needs in the community. The hospital has added behavioral and mental health care providers into its primary care & pediatric clinics, giving folks in the area more access to the care they need. https://t.co/IpCm1jBIDa

Rounded out a great day in Billings yesterday chatting with Russ Riesinger over at @KQTV—thanks again for having me on. Today, I'm headed over to Bozeman to discuss important issues in the community like health care, infrastructure, and likely a little Bobcat football. https://t.co/uI8uk04oxh

It’s my honor to help christen the Billings VA Community Based Specialty Clinic in memory of two distinguished Montana veterans, Benjamin Charles Steele and Dr. Joseph Medicine Crow. Their memory will live on as we serve vets in and around the Billings community. https://t.co/PATS2ktUYu

Got the chance to celebrate some great artists this morning at the Yellowstone Art Museum. Thanks to Bryan and the staff for having me, and for all you do to encourage creativity in the community. https://t.co/174ieWnifs

Kicking off a day in Billings this morning talking with Scott Fredericks & Mayor Bill Cole on KYAA radio—and on Scott’s birthday no less! Thanks for having me on, Scott, and have a great day! https://t.co/Z4WxKwZTrm
Happy Valentine’s Day to Sharla, who's always there to give my heart a lift. https://t.co/C636Jk2vkg

The House just voted to remove the deadline for ratifying the #EqualRightsAmendment, guaranteeing equality for women under the Constitution once and for all.

There shouldn't be a deadline on equality. Now it's the Senate's turn. It's time for #ERANow.

Math tells us 1+1=2. Science tells us exposure to Agent Orange causes detrimental effects like Hypothyroidism, Parkinsonism, & more. It's time for VA to put their money where their mouth is and provide Vietnam vets dying from Agent Orange exposure the care they desperately need. https://t.co/ab5CRUfriZ

Got to spend some time video-chatting with Ms. Flentie's 8th graders at Lewistown Jr. High School this afternoon. These young innovators were awarded the state title in this year's @SamsungUS Solve for Tomorrow competition. Next stop, nationals! https://t.co/Sd4YADTrwz

The future is bright for Montana's Special Olympics Athlete of the Year, Kandi Christophersen! Thanks for stopping by my office today and sharing your goals—your leadership and commitment to excellence for Montana athletes makes our state proud. https://t.co/Z1lz7Fv8oI

Welcome back to Earth @Astro_Christina! With 328 days and 139 million miles under your belt, your contributions to STEM will be sure to inspire young Montana scientists for generations to come. We hope to see you back in Livingston soon. https://t.co/Abwza0fi73

To continue celebrating the great work MT's Tribal Colleges and Universities do every day to support students, teachers and other members of Tribal communities, I've introduced a resolution to declare the week of February 2-8 National Tribal Colleges and Universities Week.
